column4: i updated from 6.06 (with working internet) to v6.10 and lost my network. i disabled ipv6 successfully, but still no internet. what should i do?
im using direct ethernet connection, dhcp. i checked dns, but im not eeven getting a ip address..
are you on a RealTek?
i don't know. can you paste your ifconfig output?
i can get you specific info, but i cannot paste anything since the computer is not reachable over network.
i understand.. one moment
what was the fix?
still no internet.. :(
odd. was it working previously?
ya, without a hitch in 6.06
'sudo route -n' what is 'UG' listed next to?
UG is listed on the second line, eth0 but it looks very much the same as the first line where it only says U. what info do you want?
UG stands for "use gateway". if you see your gateway listed there, then you're a step closer.
i have a gateway address on that line. is that what you mean?
if you have a gateway then can you ping it? is the gateway the correct one?
my isp appearantly has a bunch so its always changing.. will try ping now :)
yes, ping does respond :D
wow.. odd. so you do have an IP on that device?
I have 2 lines with different info, but both for eth0. one has destination and genmask ips,  the other has router ip.
i just ssh'd into your machine and fiddled around. just kidding ;)
no idea. i think your router is having a fit..
cool ;)
and fiery_cleric thank you guys VERY MUCH for your help and patience :D (very very VERY much :D :D )
a pleasure.
